title: prescribed for the purposes of section 59(2) of the Personal Insolvency Act 2012
heading: 1. These Regulations may be cited as the Personal Insolvency Act 2012
text_raw:
1. These Regulations may be cited as the Personal Insolvency Act 2012 
(Prescribed Protective Certificate Debt Settlement Arrangement Application 
Form) Regulations 2022.
text_norm: 1 regulation may cited personal insolvency act 2012 (prescribed protective certificate debt settlement arrangement application form) regulation 2022

title: prescribed for the purposes of section 59(2) of the Personal Insolvency Act 2012
heading: 2. The form set out in the Schedule to these Regulations is hereby
text_raw:
2. The form set out in the Schedule to these Regulations is hereby 
prescribed for the purposes of section 59(2) of the Personal Insolvency Act 2012 
(No. 44 of 2012).
text_norm: 2 form set schedule regulation hereby prescribed purpose section 59(2) personal insolvency act 2012 (no 44 2012)

title: prescribed for the purposes of section 59(2) of the Personal Insolvency Act 2012
heading: 3. The Personal Insolvency Act 2012 (Prescribed Protective Certificate
text_raw:
3. The Personal Insolvency Act 2012 (Prescribed Protective Certificate 
Debt Settlement Arrangement Application Form) Regulations 2013 (S.I. No. 332 
of 2013) are hereby revoked. 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
“Iris Oifigiúil” of 3rd May, 2022. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 Schedule 

[214] 3 

ISI Case Reference No.: 

APPLICATION FOR PROTECTIVE CERTIFICATE 

(DEBT SETTLEMENT ARRANGEMENT) 

*AN CHÚIRT CHUARDA 

*[THE CIRCUIT COURT] *[THE HIGH COURT] 

*PERSONAL INSOLVENCY ACT 2012 

*[………] CIRCUIT 

 *COUNTY OF [………] 

IN THE MATTER OF AN APPLICATION UNDER SECTION 61 OF THE 
PERSONAL INSOLVENCY ACT 2012 

AND IN THE MATTER OF [………………………………….] OF 
[……………………………………………………..], 

A DEBTOR 

*I/*We ………………………………………………………… 

of …………………………………………………………………. 

County of ………………………………………………………… 

*and ……………………………………………………………… 

of …………………………………………………………………. 

County of ………………………………………………………… 

HEREBY APPLY for the making of an order for the issue under section 61(2)(a) 
of the Personal Insolvency Act 2012 of a protective certificate. 

Dated………….20….. 

* Delete where inapplicable 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 4 [214] 

ISI Case Reference No.: 

Important Information and Statements

title: prescribed for the purposes of section 59(2) of the Personal Insolvency Act 2012
heading: 1. Unless otherwise defined in this application form, terms used herein have the
text_raw:
1. Unless otherwise defined in this application form, terms used herein have the 
same meaning as under the Personal Insolvency Act 2012 (the “Act”).
text_norm: 1 unless otherwise defined application form term used herein meaning personal insolvency act 2012 (the act )

title: prescribed for the purposes of section 59(2) of the Personal Insolvency Act 2012
heading: 2. This application form has been specified by the Insolvency Service for the
text_raw:
2. This application form has been specified by the Insolvency Service for the 
purposes of Section 59(2) of the Act.
text_norm: 2 application form specified insolvency service purpose section 59(2) act

title: prescribed for the purposes of section 59(2) of the Personal Insolvency Act 2012
heading: 3. The Insolvency Service may request any further information it requires from
text_raw:
3. The Insolvency Service may request any further information it requires from 
a debtor (the “Debtor”) or personal insolvency practitioner and defer further 
consideration of the application until such information is furnished to the 
Insolvency Service. Failure to furnish such information, within 14 days or such 
longer period as the Insolvency Service may (at its discretion) permit, will mean 
that the application shall be deemed to have been withdrawn.
text_norm: 3 insolvency service may request information requires debtor (the debtor ) personal insolvency practitioner defer consideration application information furnished insolvency service failure furnish information within 14 day longer period insolvency service may (at discretion) permit mean application shall deemed withdrawn

title: prescribed for the purposes of section 59(2) of the Personal Insolvency Act 2012
heading: 4. Where the personal insolvency practitioner becomes aware of any inaccuracy
text_raw:
4. Where the personal insolvency practitioner becomes aware of any inaccuracy 
or omission in this application or any document accompanying this application, 
he or she is required under section 59(4) of the Act to inform the Insolvency 
Service of this fact as soon as practicable.
text_norm: 4 personal insolvency practitioner becomes aware inaccuracy omission application document accompanying application required section 59(4) act inform insolvency service fact soon practicable

title: prescribed for the purposes of section 59(2) of the Personal Insolvency Act 2012
heading: 5. The Insolvency Service shall process the Debtor’s personal data in accordance
text_raw:
5. The Insolvency Service shall process the Debtor’s personal data in accordance 
with its Privacy Notice which is available on its website, www.isi.gov.ie.
text_norm: 5 insolvency service shall process debtor personal data accordance privacy notice available website www.isi.gov.ie

title: prescribed for the purposes of section 59(2) of the Personal Insolvency Act 2012
heading: 6. The Insolvency Service hereby agrees to the Debtor communicating with the
text_raw:
6. The Insolvency Service hereby agrees to the Debtor communicating with the 
Insolvency Service by electronic means for the purposes of any communication 
or notice required or permitted to be sent or given by the Debtor to the Insolvency 
Service, from time to time, in connection with this Act including for the purpose 
of any notice referred to in section 134 of the Act. Any such communication or 
notice should be sent to dsa@isi.gov.ie.
text_norm: 6 insolvency service hereby agrees debtor communicating insolvency service electronic mean purpose communication notice required permitted sent given debtor insolvency service time time connection act including purpose notice referred section 134 act communication notice sent dsa isi.gov.ie

title: prescribed for the purposes of section 59(2) of the Personal Insolvency Act 2012
heading: 7. Notwithstanding any agreement by the Debtor to receiving electronic
text_raw:
7. Notwithstanding any agreement by the Debtor to receiving electronic 
communications and notices, there may be circumstances in which the 
Insolvency Service will send documents, information and other communications 
to the Debtor in hard copy rather than electronically, in which case the 
Insolvency Service reserves the right to do so, including for the purpose of giving 
the Debtor any notice referred to in section 134 of the Act.
text_norm: 7 notwithstanding agreement debtor receiving electronic communication notice may circumstance insolvency service send document information communication debtor hard copy rather electronically case insolvency service reserve right including purpose giving debtor notice referred section 134 act

title: prescribed for the purposes of section 59(2) of the Personal Insolvency Act 2012
heading: 8. This application may be withdrawn at any time prior to the issue of a protective
text_raw:
8. This application may be withdrawn at any time prior to the issue of a protective 
certificate in accordance with section 59(3) of the Act.
text_norm: 8 application may withdrawn time prior issue protective certificate accordance section 59(3) act

title: prescribed for the purposes of section 59(2) of the Personal Insolvency Act 2012
heading: 9. This application shall be accompanied by the prescribed fee and the following
text_raw:
9. This application shall be accompanied by the prescribed fee and the following 
documentation: 

(a) a statement of the personal insolvency practitioner prepared under 

section 54 of the Act; 

(b) 

(c) 

(d) 

(e) 

the Debtor’s signed confirmation that he or she satisfies the 
eligibility criteria specified in section 57 of the Act; 

the Prescribed Financial Statement; 

the statutory declaration of the Debtor referred to in section 
57(1)(c) of the Act; 

 a schedule of creditors of the Debtor and the debts concerned, 
stating in relation to each such creditor the information specified 
in section 59(2)(e) of the Act; 

 
 
 [214] 5 

ISI Case Reference No.: 

(f) 

(g) 

the Debtor’s written consent to the disclosure and processing of 
his or her personal data of the Debtor as specified in section 
59(2)(f) of the Act; 

the Debtor’s written consent to the making of any enquiry under 
section 60 of the Act relating to the Debtor by the Insolvency 
Service; 

(h) 

such other documentation as may be requested in this application.

Note: This document will be completed in electronic format on such electronic 
platform that the Insolvency Service may from time to time make available or 
otherwise specify for such purpose, following which, the information will be 
processed into an output format which may be in electronic form or printed on 
paper. Where any item in this document is completed to the effect of ‘no’, or 
any item in this document is not completed, that information may not appear 
on such output format and any person reviewing the output format should 
proceed on the basis that, where the output format does not refer to such 
information, the relevant item was either completed by selecting ‘no’ or the 
relevant item was not applicable in that instance. In this document, where an 
asterisk (*) is used and a choice is provided of the appropriate response, the 
response selected will appear in the output format. This note will not appear 
on the output format. 

GIVEN under the seal of the Insolvency Service of Ireland, 

29 April, 2022. 

MICHAEL MCNAUGHTON, 

Director of the Insolvency Service of Ireland.

title: prescribed for the purposes of section 59(2) of the Personal Insolvency Act 2012
heading: (This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal
text_raw:
EXPLANATORY NOTE 

(This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal 
interpretation) 

These Regulations prescribe the form to be used when making an application to 
the Insolvency Service of Ireland for a protective certificate in respect of a 
proposed Debt Settlement Arrangement. These Regulations also revoke the 
Personal Insolvency Act 2012 (Prescribed Protective Certificate Debt Settlement 
Arrangement Application Form) Regulations 2013 (S.I. No. 332 of 2013). 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 18 [214] 

€4.50 

(ISI-4) 75. 5/22. Propylon.
